snippet: After winning over a Webster Hall crowd, the band Wild Cub said on Facebook: “Thank you New York. You gave us two sold out shows in one week, we gave you half our equipment.”
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column on joyless pockets of New York City that he says should be renamed Hindsight, based on stories from visitors; shares woes of Nashville band Wild Club, newly arrived in Prospect Heights, Brooklyn, that had most of its instruments and other equipment stolen from van they left parked on street overnight.
lead_paragraph: After winning over a Webster Hall crowd, the band Wild Cub said on Facebook: “Thank you New York. You gave us two sold out shows in one week, we gave you half our equipment.”

headline.seo: After Many Miles in a Chevy Van, a Rough Gig in a Place Called Brooklyn
headline.main: After Many Miles in a Chevy Van, a Rough Gig in a Place Called Hindsight
headline.print_headline: After Many Miles in a Chevy Van, A Rough Gig in a Place Called Hindsight
